page.title: 10 The Local Doctor
page.content: From 1840 until 1979, the Doctor in Waterhouses has been a Doctor Hall. Four generations of this family have been the sole practitioner, covering an area of some 200 sq. miles. Dr. A.G. Hall qualified as a Doctor at Manchester University and took over his father's practice in 1941. The biggest changes he has seen in 38 years are in the manner of practising and the major causes of death. At first most patients were visited by the doctor in their own homes and if medicines were necessary attended a surgery in the Doctor's house. Nowadays the majority of patients visit the Doctor at the surgery on Waterfall Lane built in 1975. In the early 1940's major causes of death were diptheria, influenza and pneumonia. Now people live longer and the major causes of death are heart disease and cancer.
